BR_text.BRdescription:
<denchmark-h:h2>Description</denchmark-h>
 
 Docevents was removed in botocore 1.18.0, which caused our workflow broken. Should we freeze boto3 version to stable version 1.14.32   <denchmark-link:https://github.com/boto/boto3/issues/2596>boto/boto3#2596</denchmark-link>
 
 <denchmark-h:h3>Error Message</denchmark-h>
 
 See <denchmark-link:https://github.com/dmlc/gluon-nlp/actions/runs/265742028>artifacts</denchmark-link>
  in most recent CI action.
 Snippet of AWS batch log stream.
 [2020-09-21T20:31:10.865Z] Traceback (most recent call last):
 [2020-09-21T20:31:10.865Z]   File "/usr/local/bin/aws", line 19, in 
 [2020-09-21T20:31:10.865Z]     import awscli.clidriver
 [2020-09-21T20:31:10.865Z]   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/awscli/clidriver.py", line 36, in 
 [2020-09-21T20:31:10.865Z]     from awscli.help import ProviderHelpCommand
 [2020-09-21T20:31:10.865Z]   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/awscli/help.py", line 23, in 
 [2020-09-21T20:31:10.865Z]     from botocore.docs.bcdoc import docevents
 [2020-09-21T20:31:10.865Z] ImportError: cannot import name 'docevents'
 <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
 
 Set boto3==1.14.32 in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/dmlc/gluon-nlp/blob/master/setup.py>setup.py</denchmark-link>
 
 <denchmark-h:h3>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
 
 (Paste the commands you ran that produced the error.)
 
 
 
 
 <denchmark-h:h2>What have you tried to solve it?</denchmark-h>
 
 
 
 
 
 <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
 
 We recommend using our script for collecting the diagnositc information. Run the following command and paste the outputs below:
 <denchmark-code>curl --retry 10 -s https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dmlc/gluon-nlp/master/tools/diagnose.py | python
 
 # paste outputs here
 </denchmark-code>

comments_0.comment_text: Would you submit a PR to fix this?
